DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week How Much Distress Other Symptom Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation in the past week how much distress they had from having other symptoms, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Past Week How Much Distress Other Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A state of physiological or psychological stress that cannot be compensated for by normal adaptive measures.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Distress Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: MSAS-SF:Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Short Form.Chang VT, et.al., Cancer. 2000 Sep 1;89(5):1162-71.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How much did your other sympt
ReferenceDocuments.description: How much did your other symptoms DISTRESS or BOTHER you?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
